individual_metadata.synopsis: Fan tribute dialog that should provide players with some tasty lore provided that they give a drink to Golbraith.Players stumle into Golbraith by exploring the city and entering his house.

22.speaker: Golbraith
22.text: I've said all I wish to the likes of you.

34.speaker: Golbraith
34.text: He has twice the kills you did at that age. He knows the seven major arteries, the blind spots - everything.
34.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself, maybe hand on chin, doesn't look up at player, trying to reassure himself

19.speaker: Golbraith
19.text: That mind flayer is done for.
19.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself, maybe hand on chin, doesn't look up at player, trying to reassure himself - DETERMINED

42.speaker: Golbraith
42.text: Forgive me, I was speaking to myself - a habit solitude has encouraged.

0.speaker: Golbraith
0.text: Everywhere - the city is infested. I've been monitoring them for months now - they're planning something. Something big.
0.context: NodeContext: glancing at player with cocked eyebrow - worried, concerned

23.speaker: Golbraith
23.text: Golbraith Stredivas - mind flayer hunter. My son is tracking one of the beasts as we speak.
23.context:
NodeContext: confident at beginning, clearly a little worried about son

(GOL-breyth STRE-di-vass; /'golbreɪθ 'stredɪvæs/)

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Does your son need any help?

45.speaker: Golbraith
45.text: No. The more minds for an illithid to feast on, the greater the risk - as I know too well. I tried to save another - and wound up retired. Permanently.
45.context: NodeContext: worried, regretful, wincing at end at the memory - he wishes desperately he could still fight

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Mind flayers are dangerous. He should stay away from them.

32.speaker: Golbraith
32.text: You don't know my boy - he's twice the hunter I am, and the best son a man could ask for.
32.context: NodeContext: proud, quietly happy, a slight smile

36.speaker: Golbraith
36.text: I'd be by his side, but an illithid trap left me retired - permanently.
36.context: NodeContext: sad, feels useless, wishes he could help his son

2.speaker: Golbraith
2.text: My son has taken up the mantle. He fights tooth and nail every single day. I only pray it's enough. That I've done enough.
2.context: NodeContext: clearly scared for his son, feels useless

50.speaker: Player
50.text: You've done your part - let us take it from here. We know how to deal with them.

15.speaker: Golbraith
15.text: It is rare to meet someone who doesn't fear mind flayers. You remind me of an old friend - a hero of his time.
15.context: NodeContext: proud, filled with admiration, hint of affection at the end (the 'hero' he met is the protagonist of BG1)

21.speaker: Golbraith
21.text: Here - he gifted me this. Call it thanks for setting me at ease.
21.context: NodeContext: proud, filled with admiration, hint of affection at the end (the 'hero' he met is the protagonist of BG1). Generic handing motion.

46.speaker: Golbraith
46.text: They won't win, you know - the mind flayers. Not with my son fighting the good fight. And you.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: If your son is half the hunter you are, he'll be all right.

16.speaker: Golbraith
16.text: He's more than that - I couldn't be prouder of him.
16.context: NodeContext: emotional, these words can't express how much he loves and adores his son.

44.speaker: Golbraith
44.text: An old friend gifted me this. Call it thanks for setting me at ease.
44.context: NodeContext: proud, filled with admiration, hint of affection at friend (the protagonist of BG1). Generic handing motion.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: If I were you, I'd leave the city. This place is done for.

29.speaker: Golbraith
29.text: Never - not while my son is out there. Not while people still need help. But it's good to know where you stand - coward.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You should be out there fighting - not hiding in here!

3.speaker: Golbraith
3.text: If I could, I would be at my son's side in a heartbeat. I have known no greater pain than being forced to watch him fight alone.

49.speaker: Golbraith
49.text: If you were the warrior you pretended to be, you'd understand that. I'll thank you to show yourself out.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I can say a prayer for your son's swift return.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I will pray that your son will swiftly and brutally murder the mind flayer.

20.speaker: Golbraith
20.text: Normally I'd refuse - we need sharp minds and sharper blades. But we could use all the help we can get.
20.context: NodeContext: Small smile to himself - he's worried about his son

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm hunting them, too - and I could use someone like you.

40.speaker: Golbraith
40.text: I'd have jumped at that chance a few years back, but an illithid trap left me retired - permanently.
40.context: NodeContext: worried, regretful, wincing at end at the memory - he wishes desperately he could still fight

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Then your son is a dead man.

18.speaker: Golbraith
18.text: You don't know my boy - he's twice the hunter I am, and the best son a man could ask for.

35.speaker: Golbraith
35.text: I'll thank you to show yourself out.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Anyone who kills those bastards is a friend of mine. Does your son need help?

28.speaker: Player
28.text: A surface dweller who hunts illithids? I'm almost impressed.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Impressive. I see the mark of a true hunter about you.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Impressive. I see the mark of a true warrior about you.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Wait - the Golbraith? I read your book on psionic manipulations and countermeasures.

27.speaker: Golbraith
27.text: I am pleased it is still widely read. I hope to publish many more such volumes.
27.context: NodeContext: a smile, he doesn't meet many who know his work

11.speaker: Golbraith
11.text: An illithid trap left me retired - permanently. Writing is how I spend much of my days now.
11.context: NodeContext: a sad smile, he feels frustrated

4.speaker: Player
4.text: You don't hear many people discussing mind flayers.

17.speaker: Golbraith
17.text: You know of them? Good - you don't meet many in this city with their eyes open.
17.context: NodeContext: glancing at player with cocked eyebrow - pleased and impressed with player

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Maybe worry about yourself - you didn't even hear me coming.

38.speaker: Golbraith
38.text: You mean before or after you thundered into my home like a wounded umber hulk? Make no mistake - you're here because I allow it.
38.context: NodeContext: glancing at player with cocked eyebrow - quietly confident.

37.speaker: Golbraith
37.text: Go on - you have mind flayers to kill.

AD_Idle_0.speaker: Golbraith
AD_Idle_0.text: Perhaps I will write this evening? I have let that manuscript languish for too long.

AD_Idle_1.speaker: Golbraith
AD_Idle_1.text: If I contact him, the illithid might sense it. I just have to wait.
AD_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: nervous, worried for his son, absolutely does not want to sit and wait

AD_Idle_2.speaker: Golbraith
AD_Idle_2.text: He'll be hungry when he's back - I should prepare dinner.
AD_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: thinking of his son - no longer worries about whether or not he'll be back. Now he knows it.

AD_Idle_3.speaker: Golbraith
AD_Idle_3.text: What if the mind flayer - no, that way lies madness.
AD_Idle_3.context: NodeContext: end of sentence is 'mind flayer ate his mind'. He's scared for his son, but trying to remain calm.

AD_Idle_4.speaker: Golbraith
AD_Idle_4.text: What is taking so long? Surely the mind flayer is dead by now.
AD_Idle_4.context: NodeContext: nervous, worried for his son

AD_Idle_5.speaker: Golbraith
AD_Idle_5.text: We can do this - the mind flayers won't win. I know it.
AD_Idle_5.context: NodeContext: he's been comforted by the player and is much more at ease now
